name: defiantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that proudly refuses to obey authority: A group of prisoners stood on the roof, defiantly waving banners. They defiantly refused to identify themselves in court.
in a way that shows you are not willing to accept criticism or disapproval: He defiantly denies having done anything wrong. She defiantly declared her innocence and claimed that prosecutors are trying to destroy her. See
defiant
More examplesFewer examplesHe defiantly returned to the country despite the arrest warrant against him.Men shook their fists defiantly at the police.He spoke forcefully and sometimes defiantly about what his agency has endured.
